info.title: Salt Edge Account Information and Payment Initiation API

get.description: You can see the list of accounts of a connection.

404.description: The User with the provided `customer_id` does not exist

400.description: Some parameters or the entire JSON request are in the wrong format

schema.description: The `id` of the Connection
A unique `id` of the User assigned by Salt Edge
The `id` of the Account the list starts with
The nr. of Accounts to be listed per page

get.description:
Returns all the connections accessible to your application for a certain customer.
The connections are sorted in ascending order of their `id`, so the newest connections will come last.
We recommend you fetch the whole list of connections to check whether any of the properties have changed.

post.description:
When not using [Salt Edge Connect](#salt_edge_connect), your app will have to pass
the user's values of Provider's [fields](#providers-fields) within the payload.

The credentials object should be modeled after the Provider's fields.

406.description: Issues related to the certificates and/ or app ID have been detected

404.description: The Client does not possess a key for the selected Provider

400.description: Some parameters or the entire JSON request are in the wrong format

post.description: In order to [reconnect](#connections-reconnect) a connection, your app needs to send the credentials object, connection's `id`, [consent object](#consents-object) and/or [attempt object](#attempts-object). This means that the consent confirmation should be handled on the client's side, and the 'access terms' the customer agreed on should be passed.

406.description: Issues related to the certificates and/ or app ID have been detected

409.description: The Connection is already being processed

404.description: The Client does not possess a key for the selected Provider

400.description: Some parameters or the entire JSON request are in the wrong format

schema.description: The `id` of the Connection

post.description:
Allows you to trigger a refetch of the data associated with a specific connection.
Note that you can refresh a connection only if it has an active [consent](#consents).
If the response is successful, it will contain the `next_refresh_possible_at` value, and you can expect the [usual callbacks](#callbacks) of the fetching workflow.

406.description: Issues related to the certificates and/ or app ID have been detected

409.description: The Connection is already being processed

404.description: The Client does not possess a key for the selected Provider

400.description: Some parameters or the entire JSON request are in the wrong format

schema.description: The `id` of the Connection

post.description:
Allows you to trigger a refetch of the data associated with a specific connection without widget.
Note that you can refresh a connection only if it has an active [consent](#consents).
If the response is successful, it will contain the `next_refresh_possible_at` value, and you can expect the [usual callbacks](#callbacks) of the fetching workflow.

data.provider_name: Fake OAuth Bank with Client Keys

400.description: Some parameters or the entire JSON request are in the wrong format

406.description: Issues related to the certificates and/ or app ID have been detected

409.description: The Connection is already being processed

404.description: The requested `connection_id` does not match any existing Connections

delete.description:
Removes a connection from our system and revokes the consent.
All the associated accounts and transactions to that connection will be destroyed as well.
Salt Edge will send a [destroy](#destroy) callback to your web application. Make sure to specify the `Destroy URL` in your client Account by accessing [callbacks page](https://www.saltedge.com/clients/callbacks/edit).

get.description:
List all of your app's customers.
This route is available only for web applications, not mobile ones.

schema.description: The `id` of the Customer the list starts with
The nr. of Customers to be listed per page

schema.description: A unique `id` of the User assigned by Salt Edge

delete.description:
Deletes a customer, returning the customer object.
Revokes all consents for this customer.
This route is available only for web applications.

404.description: The User with the provided `customer_id` does not exist

schema.description: The `id` of the Customer

get.description:
Allows you to inspect a single Provider in order to give
your users a proper interface to input their credentials.
The response will have an array of `required_fields` and `interactive_fields`,
which are explained in more detail in [the create section](#connections-create) of this reference.

data.name: Fake OAuth Bank with Client Keys

404.description: A Provider with such a `provider_code` could not be found

400.description: Some parameters or the entire JSON request are in the wrong format

schema.description: The code assigned by Salt Edge for a particular Provider includes the country code for easier differentiation. I.e.: all Spanish providers' codes end with `_es`.

Includes the Provider’s AIS fields.</br> If `true`, the following fields are available: `automatic_fetch`, `custom_pendings_period`, `holder_info`, `instruction_for_connections`, `interactive_for_connections`, `max_consent_days`, `max_fetch_interval`, `fetch_policies`, `max_interactive_delay`, `refresh_timeout`, `supported_account_extra_fields`, `supported_account_natures`, `supported_account_types`, `supported_fetch_scopes`, `supported_transaction_extra_fields`

Includes supported and required Payment fields.</br> If `true`, the following fields are available: `payment_templates`, `instruction_for_payments`, `interactive_for_payments`, `required_payment_fields`, `supported_payment_fields`, `no_funds_rejection_supported`
Includes supported and required credentials fields.</br> If `true`, the following fields are available: `credentials_fields`, `interactive_fields`

get.description:
Returns all the providers we operate with.
If a Provider becomes `disabled`, it is not included in the list.

400.description: Some parameters or the entire JSON request are in the wrong format

schema.description:
Whether to display Sandboxes and Fake Providers or not.
`true` (for Clients in Pending & Test status); `false` (for Live Clients).
Filters the Providers by country

Includes the Provider’s AIS fields.</br> If `true`, the following fields are available: `automatic_fetch`, `custom_pendings_period`, `holder_info`, `instruction_for_connections`, `interactive_for_connections`, `max_consent_days`, `max_fetch_interval`, `fetch_policies`, `max_interactive_delay`, `refresh_timeout`, `supported_account_extra_fields`, `supported_account_natures`, `supported_account_types`, `supported_fetch_scopes`, `supported_transaction_extra_fields`

Includes supported and required Payment fields.</br> If `true`, the following fields are available: `payment_templates`, `instruction_for_payments`, `interactive_for_payments`, `required_payment_fields`, `supported_payment_fields`, `no_funds_rejection_supported`
Includes supported and required credentials fields.</br> If `true`, the following fields are available: `credentials_fields`, `interactive_fields`
Excludes inactive Providers from the list
Filters Providers by key owner
Filters Providers by mode
The `id` of the Provider which the list starts with
The nr. of Providers to be listed [per page](/#pagination)

get.description:
You can get the list of all the currency rates that we support.
You will receive the currency rates starting March 21, 2014.
If any older date is requested, you will still receive the rates starting March 21, 2014.

400.description: Some parameters or the entire JSON request are in the wrong format

schema.description:
The currency rate for a specific date is returned
Possible values: any date in the `YYYY-MM-DD` format
Default value: current date

get.description: You can see the list of non-duplicated transactions of an Account.

404.description: The requested `connection_id` does not match any existing Connections

400.description: Some parameters or the entire JSON request are in the wrong format

schema.description: The `id` of the Connection
The `id` of the Account to which transactions belong

Filters transactions by pending status.
Possible values: `true`, `false`.
Returns a list of `posted` transactions if `pending`: `false` or parameter not sent.
Returns a list of `pending` transactions if `pending`: `true`.
A pending transaction is an action initiated on an Account that has been authorized but not yet fully processed or confirmed by the Provider.
Filters transactions by duplicated value
The `id` of the transaction the list starts with
The nr. of transactions to be listed per page

data.provider_name: Fake OAuth Bank with Client Keys

400.description: The Client has no access to the required route

404.description: The requested `payment_id` does not match any existing Payment

schema.description: The `id` of the Payment

connection_id.description: The `id` of the Connection the Account belongs to

name.description: The unique internal Account identifier. May not coincide with the public name of the Account

balance.description:
The latest Account balance for the main Account.
For additional balances, please refer to the [Accounts/ Extra/](#ais-accounts-extra-raw_balance) `raw_balance` parameter.

currency_code.description: The currency code of the Account in [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) format

created_at.description: The date and time in UTC when the Account was imported

updated_at.description: The date and time in UTC when the Account’s balance has changed or new transactions have been fetched

assets.description: An array of crypto codes and their corresponding amounts assigned to the investment Account

available_amount.description: The available amount in the Account's currency

balance_updated_at.description:
Timestamp indicating the last time the Account balance was modified.
This field is updated only when the Account balance changes

blocked_amount.description: The amount currently blocked in the Account’s currency

card_network.description: The card belonging to a specific financial system

cards.description: A list of masked card numbers linked to the Account

holder_name.description: The name of the individual or entity that owns the Account

closing_balance.description: Account balance at the end of an accounting period

credit_limit.description: Maximum amount of money that is allowed to be spent in the Account’s currency

current_date.description: Date of the Provider’s statement generation (applicable to Banks)

current_time.description: Time of Provider statement generation (applicable to Banks)

interest_rate.description: The interest rate of the Account as a percentage value

interest_type.description: The type of Account interest associated with the `interest_rate`

floating_interest_rate.description: Minimum and maximum values of the interest rate

masked_pan.description: Returns a partially hidden version of the typically 16-digit Primary Account Number (PAN)

remaining_payments.description: The number of remaining payments required to pay off the loan

next_payment_amount.description: Next payment amount for loans or credits

next_payment_date.description: Next payment date for loans or credits

open_date.description: The date when any type of Account or card was opened

opening_balance.description: Account balance carried forward from the end of one accounting period to the beginning of a new accounting period

partial.description: Account transactions were either not imported or only partially imported due to an internal error on the Provider’s side

provider_account_id.description: A unique `id` is assigned by the Provider to identify an Account within its system

raw_balance.description:
- The original Account balance response returned by the Provider.
- It is added only for `regulated: true` Providers.
- It is returned only if the separate `balances` parameter is present in the Provider’s original response.

sort_code.description: Routing number (US)/ BSB code (Australia)/ sort code (UK)

statement_cut_date.description: The date when the current statement transitions to the previous one

status.description: Shows whether the Account is `active`, `inactive`, or `unauthorized`

total_payment_amount.description: Total payment amount for loans or credits

transactions_count.description: Number of transactions, categorized by `posted` and `pending`

monthly_total_payment.description: The amount paid to a borrower for a month

minimum_payment.description: The lowest amount that can be paid on the credit card to avoid penalties

units.description: Nr of units owned (when used with `unit_price`)

indicative_unit_price.description: Indicative price per unit (when used with `units`)

profit_amount.description: Amount of profit/ loss of the investment Account

profit_rate.description: Rate of profit/ loss of the investment Account as a percentage value

fund_holdings.description: Fund holdings list with own values such as `investment_percentage`, `balance`, `bid_price`, `value`, `value_date`, `total_quantity`, `available_quantity`, `actual_price`, `actual_value`

life_assured_name.description: Name of the person who is assured

premium_amount.description: Amount of premium to be paid

single_premium_amount.description: Amount of single premium to be paid

policy_loan_limit.description: Maximum amount of additional Policy Loan

policy_converted_to_paid_up.description: New assured sum if the Policy is converted to a paid-up

paid_up_conversion_reversionary_bonus.description: Reversionary bonus amount after policy-to-paid-up conversion

policy_components.description: Policy components with own values such as `status`, `amount_assured`, `amount_premium`, `start_date`, `expiry_date`, `premium_expiry_date`, `assured_name`

MetaObject.description: Metaobject that contains information about pagination.

consent_id.description: The `id` of the PSD2 consent provided during this attempt

api_version.description: The API version in which the attempt was created

api_mode.description:
The API mode of the Customer that queried the API.
The `App` mode is a possible value only for Connections initiated via the previous API version.

automatic_fetch.description: Whether the Connection related to the attempt can be automatically fetched

categorize.description: Whether categorization is applied to transactions fetched during this attempt

custom_fields.description: The custom fields sent during attempt creation (any request on `/connect`, `/reconnect` or `/refresh` is considered a new attempt)

automatic_refresh.description: Whether the refresh is performed automatically for the Connection associated with this attempt

exclude_accounts.description: The IDs of accounts that shall not be refreshed

fetch_from_date.description: The starting date for fetching the data

fetch_to_date.description: The ending date for fetching the data

fetch_scopes.description:
A list of scopes deriving from the [consent_scopes](#ais-consents-attributes-scopes) options.
Possible values inside the array: `holder_info`, `accounts`, `balance`, `transactions`.
Example: to fetch accounts with a balance, use `consent_scopes`: `accounts` and `fetch_scopes`: `accounts`, `balance`

finished.description: Whether the attempt has finished fetching data

finished_recent.description: Whether the attempt has successfully started fetching data

include_natures.description: The accounts' natures that are requested to be fetched

interactive.description: Whether the attempt’s Connection has interactive steps in the Salt Edge Widget

locale.description:
The language used in the Salt Edge Widget.
Possible values: supported languages in the [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639_language_codes) format.

partial.description: Whether the Connection is partially fetched

show_consent_confirmation.description: Whether any consent is given for this attempt’s Connection in the Salt Edge Widget

store_credentials.description:
Whether the credentials are stored on the Salt Edge’s side.
Relevant for Providers with mode: `web` and `api`

user_present.description: Whether the request is initiated by the User from the Client’s application

user_agent.description: Information transmitted by a web browser or other Client application to a web server, during Attempt

device_type.description: The type of device that created the attempt

remote_ip.description: The IP of the device that created the attempt

customer_last_logged_at.description: The date & time when the User was last active in the Client’s application

created_at.description: The date & time when the attempt has been created

updated_at.description: The date & time when the attempt has been updated

success_at.description: The date & time when the attempt has been successfully finished

fail_at.description: The date & time when the attempt failed to finish

fail_error_class.description: Class of error why the attempt failed

fail_message.description: Error message explaining why the attempt failed

Stage.description: A stage represents a step performed during fetching `accounts`, `transactions`, `holder_info` on `Connect`, `Reconnect`, or `Refresh` endpoints.

id.description: The `id` of the stage from the data fetching process

name.description: The title of the stage in the data-fetching process

created_at.description: The date & time when the stage of the data fetching process has been created

updated_at.description: The date & time when the stage of the data fetching process has been updated

Connection.description:
A connection represents a set of credentials required to access the [accounts](#ais-accounts) and [transactions](#ais-transactions)
through a specific [Provider](#ais-providers).

customer_id.description: The `id` of the Customer to which the Connection belongs

customer_identifier.description: The unique external identifier of a Customer (e.g email, `id` on the Client's side)

provider_code.description: The code assigned by Salt Edge for a particular Provider includes the country code for easier differentiation. I.e.: all Spanish providers' codes end with `_es`.

provider_name.description: The Provider’s `name` used to establish the Connection

status.description: The current status of the Connection

categorization.description: The categorization type applied to transactions from this Connection

automatic_refresh.description: Whether the refresh is automatically performed for this Connection

next_refresh_possible_at.description: Determines when the next refresh will be available. This field may contain a `null` value if the Connection’s `automatic_fetch`: `false` or is already processing.

created_at.description: The date and time in UTC when the Connection was created

updated_at.description: The date and time in UTC when the Connection was updated

last_consent_id.description: The `id` of the last provided PSD2 consent

holder_info.description: Information about the holder of this Connection

cpf.description: Cadastro de Pessoas Físicas (specific to Brazil)

customer_id.description: A unique `id` of the User assigned by Salt Edge

customer_identifier.description: A unique `id` of the User assigned by the Client

scopes.description:
Data to be allowed for fetching.
The allowed values for this parameter must fall within the Client’s `allowed_fetch_scopes` and/ or the Provider's `supported_fetch_scopes` restrictions.
Possible values: `holder_info`, `accounts`, `transactions`.
`Accounts` covers both `accounts` and `balance` `fetch_scopes`

from_date.description: Allows to fetch data starting from a specified date

to_date.description: Allows to fetch data up until a specified date

period_days.description: Allows to specify the duration of consent validity (in days)

fetch_scopes.description:
A list of scopes requested by Clients from the Provider, deriving from the `consent_scopes` options.
Possible values: `holder_info`, `accounts`, `balance`, `transactions`.
Accounts `consent_scopes` covers `accounts` and `balance` `fetch_scopes`.

fetch_from_date.description: The starting date for fetching the data

fetch_to_date.description: The ending date for fetching the data

custom_fields.description: A JSON object that will be sent back on any of the Client's callbacks

locale.description:
The language of the Widget and the language of the returned error message(s).
Possible values: any locale in [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639_language_codes) format

store_credentials.description:
Whether credentials are stored on Salt Edge's side or not.
Relevant for Providers with mode: `web` and `api`

unduplication_strategy.description:
The unduplication strategy used for duplicated transactions.
The provided value remains unchanged until another value is sent during `Connections/reconnect` or `Connections/refresh`.

`mark_as_pending`: leaves identified duplicated transactions in Pending status for clients that establish connections with providers having a non-null `custom_pendings_period`.
`mark_as_duplicate`: identifies transactions as duplicated and sets the duplicated flag to `true`.
`delete_duplicated`: removes identified duplicated transactions.

return_to.description: The URL to which the User will be redirected. By default, this is the Client’s or Partner’s home URL

show_account_overview.description: Displays information about connected accounts in the Widget

credentials_strategy.description:
The strategy for storing the User’s credentials.
Relevant for Providers with mode: `web` and `api`.

javascript_callback_type.description: How the Widget interacts with the opener/ parent window

disable_provider_search.description: Enables Clients to disable Provider searches for Users

skip_provider_selection.description: Enables Users to skip the Provider selection page

skip_stages_screen.description: Allows Users to skip the stage screen

wait_all_transactions.description:
Allows the User to remain within the Widget until all Transactions have been successfully fetched.
Cannot be combined with `skip_stages_screen`.

template.description:
Allows Clients and Partners to configure a template for the Widget.
By default, Clients use `default_v3` and Partners use `partner_v3`.

theme.description:
Allows Clients to specify a color theme for the Widget.
If not set, the Widget uses the User's operating system theme preference by default

allowed_countries.description: Displays Providers only from specified countries

popular_providers_country.description:
Display in the Widget the most popular Providers from a specified country.
If nothing is sent, the most popular Providers are not shown.

skip_final_screen.description: Allows Users to skip the error and success screens

code.description: The code of the required Provider

include_sandboxes.description: Whether to display Sandboxes and Fake Providers in Provider search or not

modes.description: Restricts the list of Providers to only those that have the mode included in the array

type_of_account.description: The type of Account to be connected, only for KYC purposes

categorization.description: Enables Clients to change the applied categorization type

automatic_refresh.description: Allows Clients to enable/ disable automatic refresh. For Client the default value is `false`, for Partner `true`

scopes.description:
Data to be allowed for fetching.
The allowed values for this parameter must fall within the Client’s `allowed_fetch_scopes` and/ or the Provider's `supported_fetch_scopes` restrictions.
Possible values: `holder_info`, `accounts`, `transactions`.
`Accounts` covers both `accounts` and `balance` `fetch_scopes`

from_date.description: Allows Salt Edge to fetch data starting from a specified date

to_date.description: Allows Salt Edge to fetch data up until a specified date

period_days.description: Allows Clients to specify the duration of consent validity (in days)

fetch_scopes.description:
A list of scopes requested by Clients from the Provider, deriving from the `consent_scopes` options.
Possible values: `holder_info`, `accounts`, `balance`, `transactions`.
Accounts `consent_scopes` covers `accounts` and `balance` `fetch_scopes`.

fetch_from_date.description: The starting date for fetching the data

fetch_to_date.description: The ending date for fetching the data

exclude_accounts.description: The IDs of accounts that do not require refreshing

custom_fields.description: A JSON object that will be sent back on any of the Client's callbacks

locale.description:
The language of the Widget and the language of the returned error message(s).
Possible values: any locale in [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639_language_codes) format.

store_credentials.description:
Whether credentials are stored on Salt Edge's side or not.
Relevant for Providers with mode: `web` and `api`

unduplication_strategy.description:
The unduplication strategy used for duplicated transactions.
The provided value remains unchanged until another value is sent during `Connections/reconnect` or `Connections/refresh`.

`mark_as_pending`: leaves identified duplicated transactions in Pending status for clients that establish connections with providers having a non-null `custom_pendings_period`.
`mark_as_duplicate`: identifies transactions as duplicated and sets the duplicated flag to `true`.
`delete_duplicated`: removes identified duplicated transactions.

return_to.description: The URL to which the User will be redirected. By default, this is the Client’s or Partner’s home URL

show_account_overview.description: Displays information about connected accounts in the Widget

credentials_strategy.description:
The strategy for storing the User’s credentials.
Relevant for Providers with mode: `web` and `api`.

javascript_callback_type.description: How the Widget interacts with the opener/ parent window

skip_stages_screen.description: Allows Users to skip the stage screen

wait_all_transactions.description:
Allows the User to remain within the Widget until all Transactions have been successfully fetched.
Cannot be combined with `skip_stages_screen`.

template.description:
Allows Clients and Partners to configure a template for the Widget.
By default, Clients use `default_v3` and Partners use `partner_v3`.

theme.description:
Allows Clients to specify a color theme for the Widget.
If not set, the Widget uses the User's operating system theme preference by default

skip_final_screen.description: Allows Users to skip the error and success screens

automatic_refresh.description: Allows Clients to enable/ disable automatic refresh. For Client the default value is `false`, for Partner `true`

override_credentials_strategy.description:
Allows Clients to choose a strategy for credentials:
`ask` - the User will be prompted to confirm the credentials override upon submitting the form
`override` - new credentials will automatically override the old ones

automatic_refresh.description:
Allows Clients to enable/ disable automatic refresh.
Default value is the one that was used when the Connection had been created

override_credentials_strategy.description:
Allows Clients to choose a strategy for credentials:
`ask` - the User will be prompted to confirm the credentials override upon submitting the form
`override` - new credentials will automatically override the old ones

show_widget.description: Enables initiating a refresh without having to open the Widget

fetch_scopes.description:
A list of scopes requested by Clients from the Provider, deriving from the `consent_scopes` options.
Possible values inside the array: `holder_info`, `accounts`, `balance`, `transactions`.
Accounts `consent_scopes` covers `accounts` and `balance` `fetch_scopes`.

fetch_from_date.description: The starting date for fetching the data

fetch_to_date.description: The ending date for fetching the data

exclude_accounts.description: The IDs of accounts that do not require refreshing

custom_fields.description: A JSON object that will be sent back on any of the Client's callbacks

locale.description:
The language of the Widget and the language of the returned error message(s).
Possible values: any locale in [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639_language_codes) format.

unduplication_strategy.description:
The unduplication strategy used for duplicated transactions.
The provided value remains unchanged until another value is sent during `Connections/reconnect` or `Connections/refresh`.

`mark_as_pending`: leaves identified duplicated transactions in Pending status for clients that establish connections with providers having a non-null `custom_pendings_period`.
`mark_as_duplicate`: identifies transactions as duplicated and sets the duplicated flag to `true`.
`delete_duplicated`: removes identified duplicated transactions.

return_to.description: The URL to which the User will be redirected. By default, this is the Client’s or Partner’s home URL

show_account_overview.description: Displays information about connected accounts in the Widget

javascript_callback_type.description: How the Widget interacts with the opener/ parent window

skip_stages_screen.description: Allows Users to skip the stage screen

wait_all_transactions.description:
Allows the User to remain within the Widget until all Transactions have been successfully fetched.
Cannot be combined with `skip_stages_screen`.

template.description:
Allows Clients and Partners to configure a template for the Widget.
By default, Clients use `default_v3` and Partners use `partner_v3`.

theme.description:
Allows Clients to specify a color theme for the Widget.
If not set, the Widget uses the User's operating system theme preference by default

skip_final_screen.description: Allows Users to skip the error and success screens

fetch_scopes.description:
A list of scopes requested by Clients from the Provider, deriving from the `consent_scopes` options.
Possible values inside the array: `holder_info`, `accounts`, `balance`, `transactions`.
Accounts `consent_scopes` covers `accounts` and `balance` `fetch_scopes`.

fetch_from_date.description: The starting date for fetching the data

fetch_to_date.description: The ending date for fetching the data

exclude_accounts.description: The IDs of accounts that do not require refreshing

custom_fields.description: A JSON object that will be sent back on any of the Client's callbacks

unduplication_strategy.description:
The unduplication strategy used for duplicated transactions.
The provided value remains unchanged until another value is sent during `Connections/reconnect` or `Connections/refresh`.

`mark_as_pending`: leaves identified duplicated transactions in Pending status for clients that establish connections with providers having a non-null `custom_pendings_period`.
`mark_as_duplicate`: identifies transactions as duplicated and sets the duplicated flag to `true`.
`delete_duplicated`: removes identified duplicated transactions.

automatic_refresh.description:
Allows Clients to enable/ disable automatic refresh.
Default value is the one that was used when the Connection had been created

Allows Clients to enable/ disable automatic refresh.
If no value is sent, the setting remains unchanged

categorization.description: The applied type of categorization can be changed by Clients. If no value is sent, the setting remains unchanged.

status.description:
The status of the Connection can be changed to `inactive` by Clients.
Possible values: `inactive`
If no value is sent, the value remains unchanged

store_credentials.description:
Whether credentials are stored on Salt Edge's side or not.
Relevant for Providers with mode: `web` and `api`.
Possible values: `false`
If no value is sent, the setting remains unchanged

connection_id.description: The `id` of the Connection to which the consent belongs

customer_id.description: The `id` of the [User](/#glossary-user%2F-customer%2F-psu) who gave the consent

status.description: The current status of the consent

scopes.description:
Data to be allowed for fetching.
The allowed values for this parameter must fall within the Client’s `allowed_fetch_scopes` and/ or the Provider's `supported_fetch_scopes` restrictions.
Possible values: `holder_info`, `accounts`, `transactions`.
`Accounts` covers both `accounts` and `balance` `fetch_scopes`

period_days.description: The duration of consent validity (in days)

expires_at.description: The date & time in UTC when the consent expires

from_date.description: Allows to fetch data starting from a specified date

to_date.description: Data can be fetched up until a specified date

collected_by.description: The entity that collects the consent

revoked_at.description: The date & time in UTC when the consent has been revoked

revoke_reason.description: The reason why the consent has been revoked

created_at.description: The date & time in UTC when the consent has been created

updated_at.description: The date & time in UTC when the consent has been updated

Country.description:
The country is represented just as a string.
We're using [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country codes.
Thus, all the country codes will have exactly two uppercase letters.
There are two special cases:

- "Other", encoded as `XO`
- "Fake", encoded as `XF`

code.description: Country code as dated in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2

refresh_start_time.description: Local country time when connections will be automatically refreshed. Possible values are from `0` to `23`

Customer.description: A `Customer` represents a single end-user of the Payment Initiation API. The Client or Partner uses the API to create a Payment, which involve transferring funds from the Customer’s account to a specified recipient.

identifier.description: The unique external identifier of a Customer (e.g email, `id` on the Client's side)

blocked_at.description: The date & time in UTC when a Customer has been blocked

created_at.description: The date & time in UTC when a Customer has been created

updated_at.description: The date & time in UTC when a Customer has been updated

PartnerCustomer.description: A `Customer` represents a single end-user of the Payment Initiation API. The Client or Partner uses the API to create a Payment, which involve transferring funds from the Customer’s account to a specified recipient.

identifier.description: The unique external identifier of a Customer (e.g email, `id` on the Client's side)

blocked_at.description: The date & time in UTC when a Customer has been blocked

created_at.description: The date & time in UTC when a Customer has been created

updated_at.description: The date & time in UTC when a Customer has been updated

identifier.description: A unique `identifier` of the User assigned by the Client

email.description: A unique `email` of the User assigned by the Partner

citizenship_code.description: Possible values: country code as mentioned in [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)

registered_office_code.description: Possible values: country code as dated in [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)

Provider.description: A Provider is a source of financial data. We recommend you update all of the providers' fields at least daily.

code.description: A distinct code for identifying a Provider

bic_codes.description: List of BIC codes identifying supported branches of a specific Provider

dynamic_registration_code.description: The dynamic registration code assigned to the Provider

identification_codes.description: The list of codes identifying the supported branches of a specific Provider

group_code.description: The code of the group the Provider belongs to

group_name.description: The name of the group the Provider belongs to

hub.description: The hub that the Provider is affiliated with

status.description:
Provider’s status that indicates its state.
Possible values are: - `active` - Providers with active status are accessible, returned on both [List](#ais-providers-list) and [Show](#ais-providers-show) endpoints, and visible within the Salt Edge Widget for Users. - `inactive` - Providers with an inactive status are returned on both [List](#ais-providers-list) and [Show](#ais-providers-show) endpoints, but are not visible in the Salt Edge Widget for Users. - `disabled` - Providers with a `disabled` status are neither returned on [List](#ais-providers-list) and [Show](#ais-providers-show) endpoints, nor visible in the Salt Edge Widget for Users.

mode.description:
The way a Provider is accessed.
Possible values are: - `oauth` - access through the Provider's dedicated API redirects the User to the Provider's page for authorization. - `web` - access through the Provider's web interface using screen scraping technology. Therefore, the User undergoes the same authorization flow as on the Provider's web interface using identical credentials in the Salt Edge Widget. - `api` - access through a dedicated (`regulated: true`) or non-dedicated (`regulated: false`) Provider's API. Some required credential fields might be present, which the User must complete (such as IBAN, username, etc.). In the case of a dedicated API, an interactive redirect might be present, but required credential fields must still be completed by the User (e.g., IBAN, username, etc.). Using these credentials, the User is authorized on the Provider’s side.

regulated.description: Whether the Provider is integrated via a regulated channel under Open Banking/ PSD2

logo_url.description: The URL for the Provider logo. May contain a placeholder for Providers with missing logos

timezone.description: Time zone data for the capital/ major city in a region corresponding to the Provider

supported_iframe_embedding.description:
Indicates whether the Provider supports being embedded within an iframe.
If set to `true`, the Provider's content can be securely displayed within an iframe on external websites.

optional_interactivity.description:
Provider that supports toggling the `interactive` and `automatic_fetch` flags after connecting.
Relevant for Providers with mode: `web`

customer_notified_on_sign_in.description: Whether the Provider will notify the Customer upon a login attempt

created_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the Provider was integrated

updated_at.description: The timestamp of the most recent update to any of the Provider's attributes

automatic_fetch.description: Whether the Provider's Connections can be automatically fetched, with performance contingent on the `optional_interactivity` flag

custom_pendings_period.description:
Populated when custom_pendings: `true`.
Displays the number of days corresponding to the custom pending period implemented by the Provider.

holder_info.description: Contains information on the Account holder details retrievable from the requested Provider

instruction_for_connections.description: Provides instructions or guidance for establishing Connections with the Provider. It may contain information on the steps Users need to follow during the connection setup process.

interactive_for_connections.description: Indicates whether the Provider requires the User to perform an interactive step

max_consent_days.description:
The maximum allowed consent duration.
If the value is `null`, then there are no limits

max_fetch_interval.description:
The maximum number of days for which a Provider can return transaction data.
The maximum value varies depending on the Provider.

max_interactive_delay.description: The delay in seconds before an Unfinished error is raised

refresh_timeout.description: The amount of time, in minutes, after which the Provider's Connections are allowed to be refreshed

supported_account_extra_fields.description: An array of possible extra fields associated with Accounts that can be fetched

supported_account_natures.description: An array of possible [Account natures](#ais-accounts-attributes-nature) to be fetched

supported_account_types.description: Corporate accounts are identified as `Business` accounts.

supported_transaction_extra_fields.description: An array of possible [transaction extra](#ais-transactions-attributes-extra) fields to be fetched

payment_templates.description: Identifiers of the payment templates supported by this Provider

instruction_for_payments.description: Provides instructions or guidance for initiating Payments with the Provider

interactive_for_payments.description: Indicates whether the Provider requires the User to perform an interactive step

required_payment_fields.description: The mandatory payment attributes. If any of these fields are not passed, the Payment will not be initiated successfully

supported_payment_fields.description: If these fields are passed, they will be used by the Provider. Otherwise, the Payment will be processed even without them

no_funds_rejection_supported.description: A flag indicating whether the Provider supports explicit handling of Payment rejection due to insufficient funds

credentials_fields.description: Contains the types and details of credentials required from the User during the Connection setup process

name.description: the field's name that should be used as a key in the credentials object

english_name.description: the field's name in US English

localized_name.description: the name of the field in the provider's main language

optional.description: whether the input for this field is required by the provider

position.description: the field's position in the public user interface

interactive_fields.description: Contains the types and details of interactive elements that the User may need to provide during the Connection setup process

name.description: the field's name that should be used as a key in the credentials object

english_name.description: the field's name in US English

localized_name.description: the name of the field in the provider's main language

optional.description: whether the input for this field is required by the provider

position.description: the field's position in the public user interface

ProviderFieldOptions.description: Some providers ask their users to select a secret word or an answer to a question as a security measure. In this case, the provider will contain a field of select type. The field will contain an array of field_options objects, which describe the possible choices for the user.

name.description: the name of the field option

english_name.description: the option's name in US English

localized_name.description: the name of the field in the provider's main language

option_value.description: the value of the option that needs to be passed as credentials

selected.description: whether the choice is selected by default

Rate.description: A rate is an index of any currency value in relation to the USD currency.

currency_code.description: The currency code in [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) three-letter format

rate.description: The currency's ratio compared to the `USD` currency

fail.description:
The field indicates whether the currency rate is up-to-date.
If `true`, it means that the rate has been retrieved from the previous available date

account_id.description: The `id` of the Account the transaction belongs to

duplicated.description: Whether the transaction is a duplicate or not

made_on.description: The date when the transaction was made

created_at.description: Time and date when the transaction was imported

updated_at.description: The last time the transaction’s attributes were changed by the Client

account_balance_snapshot.description: The balance of the Account at the moment when the transaction was imported

account_number.description: The number of the Account to which the transaction belongs

additional.description: Additional information is recommended for use in concatenation with the original description, if available

asset_amount.description: The original transaction amount in asset units

asset_code.description: Asset commonly used abbreviation (Ex.: `BTC` - Bitcoin, `XAU` - Gold & Silver index, etc.)

categorization_confidence.description: A value from `0` to `1` represents the probability that the current category is the correct one

closing_balance.description: The Account balance after the transaction has been imported

constant_code.description: Payment reference for cashless domestic Payments (transfers)

convert.description: Whether the transaction amount was converted using exchange rates or not

customer_category_code.description: The category that was categorized by the rules created by the Customer

customer_category_name.description: The category that was categorized by the rules created by the Customer

exchange_rate.description: The exchange rate that was applied to the converted transaction

id.description: The transaction's identifier on the Provider’s end (not to be confused with the Salt Edge transaction `id`)

end_to_end_id.description: A unique identifier set by the merchant, typically used for reconciliation purposes

opening_balance.description: The Account balance before the transaction is imported

original_amount.description: The native amount of the transaction in the transaction's currency (provided with the `original_currency_code`)

original_category.description: The original category of the transaction

original_currency_code.description: The native currency of the transaction (provided with `original_amount`)

original_subcategory.description: The original subcategory of the transaction

payee.description: The IBAN or Account nr. to whom the money was paid

payee_information.description: Additional payee information as company/ name/ vendor etc.

payer.description: The IBAN or Account nr. of who paid the money

payer_information.description: Additional payer information as company/ name/ vendor etc.

possible_duplicate.description: It is set to `true` if the current transaction duplicates the `amount`, `made_on`, and `currency_code` of any transaction parsed in a previous attempt

posted_by_aspsp.description:
Indicates that the transaction is marked as `posted` (or `booked`) by the Provider but has the pending status assigned by Salt Edge due to `custom_pendings_period` logic.
A posted transaction is a fully processed and confirmed financial transaction that has been officially recorded in the Account, reflecting the updated balance.

posting_date.description: Date when the transaction appears in the statement

posting_time.description: Time in `HH:MM:SS` format, representing the time when the transaction appears in the statement

specific_code.description: Additional identification information for cashless domestic payments (transfers)

tags.description: User-defined information in the Provider or e-wallet interface, assigned to a transaction record is provided (not category)

time.description: The time when the transaction was made

transfer_account_name.description: The name of the linked Account

unit_price.description: Price per unit (used with units, available for investment accounts nature only)

units.description: Amount of units owned (used with `unit_price`, available for investment accounts nature only)

variable_code.description: Identifies the tax subject to the Tax Office, used for domestic payments (transfers)

connection_id.description: `id` of the Connection to which transactions belong

transaction_ids.description: The array of transactions ids for which the update should be made

duplicate.description: Marks the provided transactions as duplicated

request_id.description: A unique identifier for this specific HTTP request. Can be sent to support for debugging

request.description: The body of the request that caused the error

PaymentTemplate.description: The payment template resource contains a set of required and optional fields that need to be filled in order to successfully execute a payment. Different payment templates serve different purposes.

identifier.description: unique identifier of the payment template

description.description: additional information related to the template

payment_fields.description: list of optional and required fields for a payment

name.description: the field’s name that should be used as a key in the credentials object

english_name.description: the field’s name in US English

localized_name.description: The field’s name in the provider's main language

position.description: the field’s position in the public user interface

optional.description: whether the input for this field is optional or not

PaymentTemplateExtraField.description: The following represents the object you get in the `extra` field of the payment field object.

validation_regexp.description: the regexp used for the payment field validation

Payment.description: A payment represents the process of transferring funds through a specific [Provider](#ais-providers).

customer_id.description: The `id` of the Customer who initiated the Payment

provider_code.description: The code of the Provider through which the Payment was created and assigned by Salt Edge for a particular Provider, including the country code for easier differentiation. I.e.: all Spanish providers' codes end with `_es`

provider_name.description: The Provider’s `name` used to establish the Payment

refresh_interval.description: Defines the interval, in seconds, after which a Payment should be refreshed. This parameter specifies the number of seconds between each refresh attempt to update or verify the payment status.

refresh_timeout.description: Sets the timeout, in seconds, after which the Payment refresh attempts should stop. This parameter limits the total duration for which refresh attempts are made.

status.description:
The current status of the Payment. Possible values are:
- `initiated` - a Payment request was initiated, and Salt Edge created the attempt. The User is ready to be redirected to the Widget for Consent or directly to the Provider.
- `initiated_info_required` - a Payment request was initiated, and Salt Edge created the attempt. The user is ready to be redirected to the Widget to choose the Provider or provide additional information.
- `authorizing` - the User completed all necessary steps in the Salt Edge Widget, and the request was sent to the Provider.
- `authorized` - the User completed the authorization journey on the Provider’s side.
- `settled` - the settlement process has been completed by the Provider and the funds have been successfully transferred.
- `executed` - the Payment has been accepted by the Provider, but the settlement confirmation is still pending.
- `failed` - the Payment failed on the Salt Edge side or got rejected by the Provider.

template_identifier.description: The `identifier` of the Payment template used for this Payment

last_attempt.description: Information about the latest executed attempt is provided.

custom_fields.description: The custom fields sent during the attempt creation

created_at.description: The date and time in UTC when the Payment was created

updated_at.description: The date and time in UTC when the Payment was updated

payment_attributes.description: All the attributes (both required and optional) that are needed for a successful Payment Initiation for a specific `payment_template`

template_identifier.description:
The Payment template identifier.
Possible values: all [supported payment templates](#supported-templates")

customer_id.description: A unique `id` of the Customer to which the Payment belongs

customer_identifier.description: If `customer_id` is not sent and this field is sent, find or create such a Customer using this identifier.

code.description: The code of the required Provider

include_sandboxes.description: Whether to display Sandboxes and Fake Providers in Provider search or not

template.description:
Allows Clients and Partners to configure a template for the Widget.
By default, Clients use `default_v3` and Partners use `partner_v3`.

theme.description:
Allows Clients to specify a color theme for the Widget.
If not set, the Widget uses the User's operating system theme preference by default

javascript_callback_type.description: How the Widget interacts with the opener/ parent window

disable_provider_search.description: Enables Clients to disable Provider searches for Users

skip_provider_selection.description: Enables Users to skip the Provider selection page

popular_providers_country.description:
Displays in the Widget the most popular Providers from a specified country.
If nothing is sent, the most popular Providers are not shown

skip_final_screen.description: Allows Users to skip the error, success and confirmation screens

skip_processing_screen.description: Allows Users to skip the Payment processing screen after receiving the authorized status from the Provider

cancellation_scopes.description:
Allows the Client to indicate the purpose a Provider doesn’t perform a Payment.
Possible values: `timeout`, `insufficient_funds`.

custom_fields.description: A JSON object which will be sent back on any of the Client’s callbacks

return_to.description: The URL to which the User will be redirected. By default, this is the Client’s or Partner’s home URL

locale.description:
The language of the Widget and the language of the returned error message(s).
Possible values: any locale ISO 639-1 format

kyc.description: KYC data should be sent only by Partners for Customer Identification.

type_of_account.description: The type of Account from which the Payment will be performed, only for KYC purposes
